articles.author: David Shepardson, Joseph White
articles.description: United Auto Workers union President Shawn Fain is expected to launch walkouts at more Detroit Three auto factories Friday, barring last-minute progress in bargaining that has moved slowly since last week.
articles.title: Strikes could idle more Detroit Three auto plants Friday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes opened higher on Friday after a softer-than-expected reading on a crucial inflation metric kept alive hopes of a pause in the Federal Reserve's rate hikes.
articles.title: Wall St opens higher as softer PCE data supports rate-pause hopes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's factory activity expanded for the first time in six months in September, an official factory survey showed on Saturday, adding to a run of indicators suggesting the world's second-largest economy has begun to stabilise.
articles.title: China September factory activity expands for first time in six months

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The Biden administration proposal to hike fuel economy standards through 2032 is not feasible and could cost automakers a total of more than $14 billion in fines, an automotive group said Friday.
articles.title: Automakers say they face $14 billion in fines from Biden's 'unfeasible' fuel rules

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: Underlying U.S. inflation pressures moderated in August, with the annual rise in prices excluding food and energy falling below 4.0% for the first time in more than two years, welcome news for the Federal Reserve as it ponders the monetary policy outlook.
articles.title: Underlying US inflation pressures subside in August

articles.author: Supantha Mukherjee
articles.description: A raid by French authorities of the offices of a technology firm named as Nvidia in media reports is the latest among a string of such actions by European regulators as they look to check the dominance of Big Tech companies from thwarting competition.
articles.title: Explainer: Why is France raiding a graphics card company?

articles.author: Padraic Halpin, Max Cherney
articles.description: Chipmaker Intel (INTC.O) said on Friday it had begun high-volume production using extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography machines at its $18.5 billion plant in Ireland, calling it a "landmark" moment as it seeks to regain ground on its rivals.
articles.title: Intel hails 'landmark' as high-volume EUV production begins at Irish plant

articles.author: Moira Warburton, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Hardline Republicans in the U.S. House of Representatives on Friday rejected a bill proposed by their leader to temporarily fund the government, making it all but certain that federal agencies will partially shut down beginning Sunday.
articles.title: Hardline Republicans reject funding bill, US government shutdown imminent

articles.author: Laura Gottesdiener, Ted Hesson, Mica Rosenberg, Daina Beth Solomon
articles.description: REYNOSA, Mexico Sept 29 (Reuters) - When Carolina's captors arrived at dawn to pull her out of the stash house in the Mexican border city of Reynosa in late May, she thought they were going to force her to call her family in Venezuela again to beg them to pay $2,000 ransom.
articles.title: Migrants are being raped at Mexico border as they await entry to US

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Nandita Bose, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Top U.S. general Mark Milley retired on Friday after a four-year tenure, saying in a speech that U.S. troops take an oath to the Constitution and not a "wannabe dictator," an apparent swipe at former President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Top US general Milley takes apparent jab at Trump as he retires
